history.content:
Since the pre-reqs for CS W186 are strongly suggested, that's not what is keeping you out. I suspect it's your 'other major' designation. You can see from our CompSci enrollment policies here that you won't be eligible for open seats until the adjustment period begins. Although, feel free to join the waitlist now to give yourself the best chance possible at getting into the class.

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper

children.subject:
I am also a rising senior in a (sort of) similar situation as I am also not CS/EECS and I am hoping to enroll in w186. I am currently 93rd on the waitlist and was wondering if it is likely for me to be enrolled once the adjustment period begins? classes.berkeley.edu says there are 111 open seats left in the class so I am not confident about getting off the waitlist. 

Also, since this class is web-based, how likely is it that the class size will expand to accommodate more students? Thanks!

I wish I could answer that question directly but I cannot. Hiring budgets for TA support are tighter than ever. So, even if the lecture is web cast, we may not have enough TAs to support expanding enrollment.

At this point, my best suggestion is to have a good backup plan an monitor what happens to your waitlist position after August 16th when the adjustment period opens. 

If we do expand the class, expect the expansion to be relatively small and it could come as late as the start of classes.

history.content:
I am a rising senior who majored in other major and intend to minor/major CS. I am taking CS61A this summer. I try to enroll DATAC100 or COMPSCI W186 as an elective upper-division class, but I failed to enroll them both. I assume it was the problem that I haven't the letter grade of CS61A yet. I want to know how to figure it out?

Thanks advanced!!!

BTW, I have not to take Math54 yet. I just took DATAC8 before and I am taking cs61A now. I wonder does Math54 is a prerequisite or corequisite for many upper-division classes? (Because I am not sure I can major the CS, so I want to choose some classes can overlap for major and minor first for the Fall 2021 semester. I know Math54 is unnecessary for minor.)
history.subject: Class enrollment
